<< Contents: Q13c. The cost of living has recently increased, seeing a rise in overall costs (such as food, utilities and household expenses). Which, if any, of the following best describes how you've approached the rising cost of living so far?

Unnamed: 2: Tried to earn more money e.g., by working more hours or finding more/different work
Unnamed: 3: Taken on new borrowing or used a credit card to pay for essential bills such as rent, energy, council tax
Unnamed: 4: Reduced spending on transport due to cost
Unnamed: 5: Reduced spending on food for adults due to cost
Unnamed: 6: Reduced spending on food for children due to cost
Unnamed: 7: Changed the type of food your household buys due to cost (e.g. consuming less fresh produce or more processed foods)
Unnamed: 8: Changed the way you cook (eg. to consume less cooking appliance energy) due to cost
Unnamed: 9: Used appliances less often to reduce cost
Unnamed: 10: Heated my home less than I needed to / less often to reduce cost
Unnamed: 11: Reduced number of showers or baths taken in my house due to energy cost
Unnamed: 12: Have not replaced broken items due to cost
Unnamed: 13: Have not replaced clothing that is outgrown or worn due to cost
Unnamed: 14: Reduced spending on gifts for family, due to cost
Unnamed: 16: I have stopped some or all insurance payments
Unnamed: 17: Reduced or stopped pension contributions from my salary
Unnamed: 19: Used a warm bank (a dedicated warm public space for people to spend time to save costs on heating their home)
Unnamed: 20: Stopped or reduced socialising with friends and family due to cost
